com.pump.swing

Class QOptionPaneCommon

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.pump.swing.QOptionPaneCommon

  • public class QOptionPaneCommon
extends java.lang.Object
    A set of static methods for common dialog needs.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int DISCARD_CHANGES_OPTION
      A possible return value for showReviewChangesDialog() indicating the user wants to discard all changes to dirty documents.
      static int FILE_EXTERNAL_CHANGES
      Use this to save a file that has experienced external changes.
      static int FILE_NORMAL
      Use this for the a normal save dialog.
      static int REVIEW_CHANGES_OPTION
      A possible return value for showReviewChangesDialog() indicating the user wants to review all dirty documents.

    • Method Detail

      • showSaveDialog

        public static int showSaveDialog(java.awt.Frame owner,
                                 java.lang.String appName,
                                 java.lang.String documentName,
                                 java.lang.String filePath,
                                 boolean saveProducesDialog,
                                 int fileState,
                                 boolean useSheets)
        Display a dialog prompting the user to save, don't save, or cancel.
        Parameters:
        owner - the frame that hosts this dialog.
        appName - the application name
        documentName - the name of the document
        filePath - the path of the document
        saveProducesDialog - whether clicking "Save" will produce another dialog. (Ellipses may be appended to the save button in this case.)
        Returns:
        one of the QDialog constants for SAVE, DONT_SAVE or CANCEL.

      • showSaveDialog

        public static javax.swing.JInternalFrame showSaveDialog(javax.swing.JDesktopPane desktopPane,
                                                        java.lang.String appName,
                                                        java.lang.String documentName,
                                                        java.lang.String filePath,
                                                        boolean saveProducesDialog,
                                                        int fileState)
        Display a dialog prompting the user to save, don't save, or cancel.

        Note this produces does not have a return value because the resulting JInternalFrame is not modal (so it doesn't return immediately). This method exists only as a demonstration.

        Parameters:
        desktopPane - the desktopPane that contains this dialog.
        appName - the application name
        documentName - the name of the document
        filePath - the path of the document
        saveProducesDialog - whether clicking "Save" will produce another dialog. (Ellipses may be appended to the save button in this case.)
        Returns:
        the internal frame created.

      • showReviewChangesDialog

        public static int showReviewChangesDialog(java.awt.Frame owner,
                                          java.lang.String appName,
                                          int documentCount,
                                          boolean useSheets)
        Display a dialog prompting the user to review all unsaved changes, discard them, or cancel.

        This is similar to a save dialog, except it is shown when the user has multiple unsaved files open.

        Pressing the escape key triggers the cancel button, but this button does not have mnemonics for "Review Changes..." and "Discard Changes". I assume this is because the most likely mnemonic for "Discard Changes" is "D", and if the user skims this dialog and automatically tries to select the "D" option without thinking: that user is risking losing much more data than the foremost window alone might suggest.

        Parameters:
        owner - the frame that contains this dialog.
        appName - the application name.
        documentCount - the number of open documents.
        Returns:
        REVIEW_CHANGES_OPTION, DISCARD_CHANGES_OPTION, or DialogFooter.CANCEL_OPTION.

      • showReviewChangesDialog

        public static javax.swing.JInternalFrame showReviewChangesDialog(javax.swing.JDesktopPane desktopPane,
                                                                 java.lang.String appName,
                                                                 int documentCount)
        Display a dialog prompting the user to review all unsaved changes, discard them, or cancel.

        This is similar to a save dialog, except it is shown when the user has multiple unsaved files open.

        Pressing the escape key triggers the cancel button, but this button does not have mnemonics for "Review Changes..." and "Discard Changes". I assume this is because the most likely mnemonic for "Discard Changes" is "D", and if the user skims this dialog and automatically tries to select the "D" option without thinking: that user is risking losing much more data than the foremost window alone might suggest.

        Note this produces does not have a return value because the resulting JInternalFrame is not modal (so it doesn't return immediately). This method exists only as a demonstration.

        Parameters:
        desktopPane - the desktopPane that contains this dialog.
        appName - the application name.
        documentCount - the number of open documents.
        Returns:
        the internal frame created.
